avalancheActivity.comment: Still low avalanche danger. Danger spots can be located in high altitudes in shady, extremely steep areas. There slab avalanches and driftsnow accumulations could be triggered. In sunny slopes spontaneous wet snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Avalanche danger low. Danger spots only in some places in shady, extremely steep areas.

snowpackStructure.comment: In high altitudes small amounts of snowdrift accumulations have formed which partially are on top of faceted snow which can be considered as weak layers in rare cases. The snow surface will get wet, especially on sunny slopes. Blown-off areas are hard and icy. The kinetic metamorphosis weakens the snow base on shady slopes. In general usual low amount of snow.

tendency.highlights: On Sunday it will be predominantly cloudy but with hardly any precipitation. The avalanche danger stays low.

weatherForecast.comment: A southwestern stream will cause mild, partially sunny weather in the Styrian mountains. From noon on some veiling clouds can occur. Temperatures in 2.000 at noon are around 7 degrees in the northern Alps and 3 degrees in the southern mountains. Weak to moderate winds which turn from southwest to West during the course of the day.

customData.generalHeadline: The avalanche danger is in general low. Danger spots only in some places.
